ul.li1: 8Sixty queens there are, eighty concubines,
9My dove, she is the one;Literally “she is one”The term “one” functions here as an adjective of quality: “unique, singular, the only one”
ul.li2: my perfect, she is the only one;Literally “she is one”Or “the only daughter of her mother.” Although the latter option is permissible, the term is used elsewhere of the heir as the favored child (e.g., Gen 22:2; Prov 4:3). This nuance is supported by the parallel term “favorite”
ul.li3: she is the favorite ofOr “she is the pure one.” Since there are two Hebrew terms spelled the same way, some relate this to the adjective that means “pure.” Others relate it to the verb that means “to choose, select.” The parallelism favors the latterLiterally “the favorite for” her mother who bore her.
ul.li1: Maidens see her and consider her fortunate;Or “call her happy” or “call her blessed” or “bless her”

beautiful as the moon,
